intro: Scutellaria altissima, commonly known as tall skullcap, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows up to 2 to 3 feet tall, featuring square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple, tubular in shape, and arranged in whorls along the stem. The plant is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
